title: How to Make Your Computer Welcome You

steps.title: Press 'Windows+R' from your keyboard.
steps.content: Press 'Windows+R' from your keyboard. It'll open 'Run' window.

steps.title: Type notepad without the quote, and press the 'Enter' key.
steps.content: Type notepad without the quote, and press the 'Enter' key. It'll open a 'Notepad' window.

steps.title: Type these lines shown in the image below carefully.
steps.content: Type these lines shown in the image below carefully. Dim speaks, speech speaks="Welcome to your System, Paul. Have a wonderful time dear." Set speech=CreateObject("sapi.spvoice") speech.Speak speaks

steps.title: In the 2nd line, i.e.
steps.content: In the 2nd line, i.e. "speaks=" Type whatever you want your computer to speak" ".

steps.title: Type the rest all as shown in the image.
steps.content: Type the rest all as shown in the image.

steps.title: Save the file under any name, but make sure to put in '.vbs' followed by the file name (just like filename.vbs.
steps.content: Save the file under any name, but make sure to put in '.vbs' followed by the file name (just like filename.vbs . ) For example, if you write "abc.vbs", 'abc' will be the name of the file.

steps.title: Click 'windows start button', and then 'all programs'.
steps.content: Click 'windows start button', and then 'all programs'. Scroll down,and look for a folder with a name that says 'Startup'. (This step won't work in Windows XP.)

steps.title: Right click 'Startup' and click open.
steps.content: Right click 'Startup' and click open. It'll open this folder window for you.

steps.title: Place that file 'abc.vbs' in this folder.
steps.content: Place that file 'abc.vbs' in this folder. Simple cut/copy and paste here.

steps.title: Turn off or restart your computer.
steps.content: Turn off or restart your computer. If you followed the same steps without any mistake, your computer will speak whatever you typed.
